revised_title: Endocytosis in Secretory Cells: Retrieval of Membrane after Exocytosis
tldr: The article discusses the process of endocytosis in secretory cells, specifically how excess membrane is retrieved after exocytosis. It describes two major pathways for endocytic vesicles and their relation to membrane recycling, using electron dense tracers to track the fate of membrane removed after induced exocytosis.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Cell Biology
